**Rotate into Safe-Haven Assets**: As the market becomes more volatile, investors tend to seek safe-haven assets.
**Rotate into Stronger Sectors**: As the market changes, rotate your investments into sectors that show relative strength compared to others.
**Rotate into Safer Assets**: Allocate your portfolio across these defensive sectors, with an emphasis on larger, more stable companies.
**Diversify across Sub-Sectors**: Within each defensive sector, diversify your holdings across various sub-sectors to reduce exposure to individual company risks.

3. **Rotate into Cyclicals when necessary**: As the market bottoms out or shows signs of recovery, rotate a portion of your portfolio into Cyclical sectors (e.g., Technology, Industrials, Materials) to take advantage of potential upswings.
3. **Large-Cap Stocks**: Focus on large-cap stocks with a strong track record of stability and dividend payments.
These tend to be less volatile than smaller companies.
This will help mitigate potential losses.
